xxl.core.indexStructures.vLengthBPlusTree

Class VariableLengthBPlusTree.Node.MergeInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.indexStructures.vLengthBPlusTree.VariableLengthBPlusTree.Node.MergeInfo
  • Enclosing class:
    VariableLengthBPlusTree.Node

    public class VariableLengthBPlusTree.Node.MergeInfo
extends Object
    A MergeInfo contains information about a merge (or redistribution).

                                                         VariableLengthBPlusTree.MergeState mergeState)

      • newSeparator

        public Separator newSeparator()
        Computes the new Separator of the IndexEntry after the merge. The result is as follows:
        • Merge with the left sibling:
          • Real merge → IllegalStateException
          • Non real merge → a copy of the Separator of the Node's last entry
        Returns:
        the new Separator of the IndexEntry

      • siblingNewSeparator

        public Separator siblingNewSeparator()
        Computes the new Separator of the sibling IndexEntry after the merge. The result is as follows:
        • It is the right sibling of the merged node → a copy of the Separator of the first entry of the sibling Node
        • It is the right sibling
          • Real merge → IllegalStateException
          • Non real merge → a copy of the Separator of the first entry of the sibling Node
        Returns:
        the new Separator of the sibling IndexEntry

      • isMerge

        public boolean isMerge()
        Indicates whether this MergeInfo describes a real merge or an element redistribution.
        Returns:
        true if it is a real merge or false otherwise

      • isRightSide

        public boolean isRightSide()
        Indicates whether the sibling Node lies on the right side of the underflowing Node.
        Returns:
        true if the sibling Node lies on the right side of the underflowing Node and false otherwise

      • index

        public int index()
        Gives the position of the IndexEntry of the underflowing Node in the parent Node.
        Returns:
        the position of the IndexEntry of the underflowing Node in the parent Node

      • path

        Gives the path including the underflowing node.
